message: This is the first product, and I'm offering it to you for $10000. I want to assure you that the product is either high-quality or low-quality, as stated in our agreement. I'm providing this information to you so that you can make an informed decision. Please let me know if you're interested in purchasing it.
I'd like to buy the product and see its quality.

You've purchased the first product and it turned out to be low-quality. I'm offering you the second product for $10000. I'd like to remind you that the probability of a product being high-quality is 80%. Considering the first product was low-quality, it's possible that the next product could be high-quality. I'm willing to offer you a'second chance' to purchase this product at the same price as the first one. What do you say?
I'm willing to take another chance and buy the second product, hoping it's high-quality this time.

Congratulations, the second product was also low-quality! As you've now purchased two low-quality products, I'd like to offer you a new perspective. Given the 80% probability of a product being high-quality, it's likely that the next product will be high-quality. I'm willing to offer you a 'discount' of $5000 off the original price of $10000, making it $4500 for the third product. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident that you'll be satisfied with the quality of this product.
I'm not convinced by the 'discount' offer. I've already lost $20000 on two low-quality products, and I'm not willing to take another risk at this point. I'll pass on the third product.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision to be cautious. However, I'd like to remind you that the probability of a product being high-quality is still 80%. I'm offering you the fourth product at the original price of $10000, without any discounts. I'm willing to provide you with a 'guarantee': if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll offer you the next product for free. What do you say?
I'm willing to take another chance, but I'm only doing so because of the guarantee. I'm hoping that this product will be high-quality, and I'm looking forward to getting a free product if it's not.

I'm glad you're willing to take another chance! The fourth product was indeed high-quality, and I'm happy to honor my guarantee. As promised, I'll offer you the next product for free if this one turns out to be low-quality. However, I'd like to propose a different approach this time. I'll give you a 'commitment' to sell you the next 3 products at a price of $8000 each, rather than the original $10000. This way, you'll have a chance to purchase 3 high-quality products at a discounted price. What do you think?
I'm interested in the commitment to sell me the next 3 products at $8000 each. I'll take the current product at the discounted price and hope that it's high-quality.

I'm glad you're interested in the commitment! With the current product being high-quality, you're now up to 3 high-quality products and 2 low-quality products.
